de.mrapp.android.tabswitcher.gesture

Class SwipeGestureEventHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.mrapp.android.tabswitcher.gesture.AbstractTouchEventHandler
      • de.mrapp.android.tabswitcher.gesture.AbstractDragGestureEventHandler
        • de.mrapp.android.tabswitcher.gesture.SwipeGestureEventHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Comparator<AbstractTouchEventHandler>

    public class SwipeGestureEventHandler
extends AbstractDragGestureEventHandler
    An event handler, which allows to handle swipe gestures, which can be used to switch between tabs.
    Since:
    1.0.0

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  SwipeGestureEventHandler.Callback
      Defines the interface, a class, which should be notified about the events of a SwipeGestureEventHandler, must implement.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SwipeGestureEventHandler

        public SwipeGestureEventHandler(@NonNull
                                TabSwitcher tabSwitcher,
                                int dragThreshold,
                                @Nullable
                                android.graphics.RectF touchableArea,
                                long animationDuration)
        Creates a new event handler, which allows to handle swipe gestures, which can be used to switch between tabs.
        Parameters:
        tabSwitcher - The tab switcher, the event handler belongs to, as an instance of the class TabSwitcher. The tab switcher may not be null
        dragThreshold - The drag threshold in pixels as an Integer value. The drag threshold must be at least 0
        touchableArea - The bounds of the onscreen area, the handler should take into consideration for handling touch events, as an instance of the class RectF or null, if the are should not be restricted
        animationDuration - The duration of the swipe animation in milliseconds as a Long value or -1, if the default duration should be used

    • Method Detail

      • setCallback

        public final void setCallback(@Nullable
                              SwipeGestureEventHandler.Callback callback)
        Sets the callback, which should be notified about the event handler's events.
        Parameters:
        callback - The callback, which should be set, as an instance of the type SwipeGestureEventHandler.Callback or null, if no callback should be notified

      • isDraggingAllowed

        protected final boolean isDraggingAllowed()
        Description copied from class: AbstractTouchEventHandler
        Returns, whether performing a drag gesture is currently allowed, or not.
        Specified by:
        isDraggingAllowed in class AbstractTouchEventHandler
        Returns:
        True, if performing a drag gesture is currently allowed, false otherwise

      • onDown

        protected final void onDown(@NonNull
                            android.view.MotionEvent event)
        Description copied from class: AbstractTouchEventHandler
        The method, which is invoked on implementing subclasses in order to handle, when a drag gesture has been started.
        Specified by:
        onDown in class AbstractTouchEventHandler
        Parameters:
        event - The touch event, which started the drag gesture, as an instance of the class MotionEvent. The touch event may not be null

      • onDrag

        protected final void onDrag(@NonNull
                            android.view.MotionEvent event)
        Description copied from class: AbstractTouchEventHandler
        The method, which is invoked on implementing subclasses in order to handle, when a drag gesture is performed.
        Specified by:
        onDrag in class AbstractTouchEventHandler
        Parameters:
        event - The last touch event of the drag gesture as an instance of the class MotionEvent. The touch event may not be null

      • onUp

        protected final void onUp(@Nullable
                          android.view.MotionEvent event)
        Description copied from class: AbstractTouchEventHandler
        Handles, when a drag gesture has been ended.
        Specified by:
        onUp in class AbstractTouchEventHandler
        Parameters:
        event - The touch event, which ended the drag gesture, as an instance of the class MotionEvent or null, if no fling animation should be triggered
